Recap: Starr rushes to the door and finds out that it is Todd standing there. Todd asks her if she were expecting Cole. Star lets Todd know that Marty is putting Cole in military school. Marty insists on sending Cole away so she won't lose him like they lost his father .Adriana looks over some of Tate's pictures. Tate comes in and join her. Adriana points out that she is going to lay down some ground rules or she will not be able to work with him anymore. Jessica bas brought Bree to spend some time with Nash .Nash thanks Jessica for bringing Bree by. Rex pokes his head into Bo's office. Bo asks him to come in. Bo shows him a Ziploc bag with cash. Rex is impressed by the money. Bo tells him to take it .Evangeline is in the squad room with Nora. Antonio comes in, and tells Nora that he thinks that they have a lead in the arsonist case. Talia shows Nora some pictures. Evangeline asks Antonio how Christian is. Nora knows the medallion belongs to the arsonist. Bo explains that this money is the money that was taken in the robbery at Roxie's. Bo questions him as to what has been going on with him. Rex fills him in as to what had happened. Bo is impressed that Rex has a new career as a model for men's lingerie. Rex resents Tate coming on to Adriana. Tate reaches over and takes Adriana's hand. Cole and Marty argue over his going away to military school. Starr fills Todd in on the military school that Cole is going to. Starr blames Todd for ruining her life. Starr insists that she only wants Cole. Starr tells Todd that she doesn't love him. Nash encourages Jessica to stay. Evangeline drops off some papers for Marty to appear in court. Todd doesn't want to make Starr unhappy. Starr tells Todd that he is making a big mistake. Starr's cell phone rings, and Starr thinks that it is Cole. Bo and Rex discuss Tate and his attraction to Adriana .Nora becomes frustrated that the police has nothing to go on to find the arsonist. Two of Tate's big fans join him at his table .Adriana rejoin them. Tate tells the two girls that Adriana is his girlfriend. Rex join Roxie at the Angel Square Diner. Roxie tells Rex to fork over the money. Roxie begins to count the money. Rex tells Roxie that he had had a fight with Adriana over another man. Nash tells Jessica that he is not impressed that she loves her husband as much as she says she does. Bo brings Nora into his office to hash out their problems in the arsonist investigation. Bo fills her in as to what had happened to Talia. Evangeline tells Marty that she is a bad judge of character. Todd redials the number and finds out that the call was from Cole.

Todd tells Cole that if he calls Starr again that he will get a restraining order against him. Todd decides to keep Starr's cell phone. Marty and Evangeline discuss Todd and his role in Evangeline's life. Evangeline knows that she is not over Christian. Nora is angry over what had happened to her and Matthew. Nora only wants answers. Rex lets Roxie know that Adriana isn't two-timing him. Jessica refuses to talk about Antonio to Nash. She gets up and leaves. Roxie decides to take Rex to the Palace for a big lunch. Tate insists that he will back off. Nora thanks Talia for her help. Rex and Roxie comes in and sees Adruaba and Tate together.
Transcript: [Knock on door]
Todd: Expecting Cole?
Starr: No.
Todd: No? Hoping it was him?
Starr: I know better. Why are you here?
Todd: Uh -- I wanted to make sure you weren't in school. Until I know that Cole's not going back to school, neither are you.
Starr: It's over, Dad. Cole's never coming back to Llanview High. His mom's not just putting him in boarding school, she's putting him in military school. Happy now?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marty: "Every cadet has the opportunity to participate and compete if he or she is determined to do so." Look, Cole, you can play football again, ok, after the initial period of probation.
Cole: I don't care, ok? Because I don't want this!
Marty: Yeah, well, I wish I had a choice.
Cole: I won't lie anymore, ok?
Marty: Are you going to see Starr Manning? Well, at least you didn't lie.
Cole: You don't get it, do you?
Marty: No, I get it, Cole, ok? And I also get the fact that Todd Manning would like nothing better --
Cole: I can handle Starr's dad, ok?
Marty: No! No, you can't! And neither can I, ok? So that is why I am sending you away, because I am not going to lose you, like we lost your father.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tate: I suppose I should be flattered.
Adriana: Why?
Tate: Well, the way you're looking at those pictures.
Adriana: It's my job.
Tate: To stare at men in their underwear?
Adriana: Yeah.
Tate: Well, that's a tough way to make a living.
Adriana: All right, Tate, we're going to have to set some rules. Or I can't work with you anymore.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jessica: Um -- she was up really early this morning, so she'll probably nap for a while.
Nash: I thought you said Antonio was bringing her by.
Jessica: Antonio got caught up with a case and he couldn't break away.
Nash: I think your mommy is not telling the truth about that. How are you?
Jessica: I am telling the truth. He's a cop, he has emergencies.
Nash: Of course he does.
Jessica: I'll see you later, sweetie.
Nash: Thank you for bringing her by. Good to see you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
[Knock on door]
Bo: Come in.
Rex: You wanted to see me?
Bo: Yeah, come on in. Close the door.
Rex: What's up?
Bo: Open it up.
Rex: Whoa. That is mucho cash.
Bo: Take it.

Evangeline: God, where are they? You may have to take this meeting alone.

Talia: It's a medallion of some kind. We're hoping it doesn't belong to you or your family.
Nora: Well, show it to me.
Talia: I took video at the scene. It's a -- a still frame from the footage.
Nora: What -- what -- what is this? I can't -- it's blurry. It's -- I mean, can we -- can we blow it up or enhance it or something?
Talia: I was about to work on it right now. You -- you can wait if you want.
Nora: Yes, I want.
Evangeline: Nora, please, let me know the minute you find anything out.
Nora: Yeah, yeah, I will call you.
Evangeline: Ok. Hey. How's Cristian?
Antonio: Ok, I guess. He's doing me a big favor by watching the club.
Evangeline: I can only imagine what he said about me. And I guess I probably don't want to know. So I'm sorry for bringing it up. I have somewhere to be. Excuse me.
Nora: This medallion is going to lead us to the arsonist, I know it. I feel it.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rex: For me? All this cash?
Bo: No. No, that -- that's Roxy's money. That's the money that was taken in the robbery at her salon. Oh, Balsom, the perps -- they -- they didn't get a chance to spend a nickel of it.
Rex: Well, that's really cool, No, she'll be very happy.
Bo: Well, I'm sure glad to hear that, but you know what? You thought that I just handed you a bag of cold, hard cash for no reason, right? You were going to keep it.
Rex: No, I was kidding.
Bo: Yeah?
Rex: I'd only have taken it if you'd insisted.
Bo: Oh, really? That's reassuring. God, Balsom -- so how's everything going with you otherwise?
Rex: Good. I got stuck up on Llantano Mountain the other night. The ice storm.
Bo: What? You ski?
Rex: A little. This was a work thing. Adriana was shooting a spread for a clothing line.
Bo: Yeah, the underwear deal, right?
Rex: Yeah. Don't lose respect for me, ok? But when one of the models got stuck at the bottom of the mountain, I --
Bo: No.
Rex: They were desperate. She's my girlfriend. Threat of death. What could I do?
Bo: Balsom, this could be a whole new career for you.
Rex: Don't start, huh?
Bo: When do we get to see these pictures?
Rex: Sometime soon, I'm guessing -- unless I end up on the cutting-room floor, which would be a huge relief.
Bo: Nah. Come on, come on. Don't you think that'd be exciting, though? You'd get to see yourself in a -- in a magazine with -- [Bo chuckles]

Rex: Yeah, wearing nothing but underwear. Spur of the moment. No spray tan, no six weeks with a trainer. Right. That should be very exciting, in a humiliating sort of way. Now, had the right model gotten hung up, it might have been worth it.
Bo: Hmm. What do you mean?
Rex: The star of the ads, Tate Harmon. Too bad he didn't get stuck at the bottom of that mountain.
Bo: You have a problem with the guy?
Rex: Me? Nah! No, I'm way too secure to be threatened by a hunky sports star flirting his ass off with my girlfriend. Doesn't faze me in the least.

Tate: Look, if I offended you in some way, I'm sorry.

Adriana: I do. It's just that Rex was already a little bothered by your interest in me, and when he heard about that, slightly bothered turned into highly suspicious.
Tate: Why? Doesn't he trust you?
Adriana: Of course he trusts me. We're great together, completed committed to each other. It's not a big deal. It's just I don't like him to stress out about these sort of things.
Tate: Ok, I get it. You and Rex are a team. I would never make a move on another guy's girlfriend. I'm serious. I would never come between two people in love.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cole: What happened to dad has nothing to do with what's going on right now. It's about me and Starr and your need to control me.
Marty: Cole, you're my son. My only need is to protect you and to help you make good decisions.
Cole: Decisions that make me feel miserable? And why do I need your help with anything? What, am I in preschool?
Marty: Well, when you behave like this, yes.
Cole: Damn it, mom, I can take care of myself!
Marty: Can you? Can you really? Is that why you insist at every turn to betray my trust?

Cole: Fine, then. If I've disappointed you so badly, if I'm such a disgrace, then send me off to military school and be done with it. And then you'll never have to deal with me again, and won't -- won't that be such a relief?
Marty: Cole, that is not what this is about, and you know it, so just stop it.
Cole: Do what you need to do, mom. You know, if sending me away is the answer to all this, then --

Marty: Do I look like somebody who has all the answers? You know, I am figuring this out as I go along, and you are not helping! When your father was here, we made these decisions together. And I would try to think of what he might say, but I can't, ok? I'm on my own, and I am doing the best I can, and if you don't like it, well, that's just tough, because I am the only mother that you've got.
Cole: All that matters to me is Starr.

Marty: I get that. Oh, I get that. But you are my son, and you are all that matters to me. I love you with all my heart, Cole. And I can't just stand by and let you throw your life away. I need to get to work. When I get home, we will go through the curriculum book, and you will pick out the courses you want to take. And that is what you are going to be focusing on right now.

Todd: Which military academy?
Starr: I don't know, dad. Someplace probably very far away from Llanview full of juvenile delinquents with guns.

Starr: Oh, thank you, Dad. That makes me feel a whole lot better.
Todd: Listen, honey, I want to talk to you about --
Starr: No, you listen to me. My life is ruined, and it's all your fault.
Todd: Ok. Marty's decision had nothing to do with me, and as far as ruining your life -- you're just a kid, remember? Actually, you're my kid. And there's going to be other boys, believe me.
Starr: I don't want other boys, dad, I want Cole!
Todd: I just don't think Cole's worthy of you, sweetie. He's an idiot.
Starr: Don't say that about him! I love Cole. And right now, I don't love you.

Jessica: We have to figure something else out. If Antonio's not available to drop her off, I'll just get my mom or my sister to, ok?

Evangeline: Oh, hey, Marty.

Marty: What is it?
Evangeline: Another perp that wants to get off. I imagine he'll be calling you to testify on his behalf. So in the spirit of full disclosure, I thought I would drop off the file on the case.
Marty: He's not a patient of mine.
Evangeline: Neither was Spencer Truman. You have a reputation in town now. A couple of sessions with you, and a murderer can get off with an insanity plea.
Marty: So did you just drop this off as an excuse to pick a fight?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Todd: I can see you're upset about it.
Starr: Wow, dad, you're so perceptive.

Starr: Not seeing Cole is what's worst for me. It's torture.
Todd: I'm sure it is.

Todd: Sweetheart, I know that you think you're feeling love for him right now, but --
Starr: Don't tell me how I feel! If I were to ever tell you how you feel, my God --
Todd: Honey, I'm not trying to make you unhappy. That's the last thing I want to do.
Starr: Dad, you don't know Cole the way I do. What's the point of even telling you that? You've already made up your mind.
Todd: Do you think I'm a good father?
Starr: Of course, but -- dad, you're making a big mistake about Cole.
Todd: Have I ever led you astray?
Starr: No, but this is different, this is --

Starr: Dad, like I said, this is different. I'm not a kid anymore.
Todd: I know. You're -- you're grown up. And all grownups experience this. And they get over it. You will, too.
Starr: No, I'm not like them. I'll never get over it.

Todd: Why are you not rushing to get that? Afraid it's Cole?

Bo: You really worried about this?

Bo: Hmm?
Rex: So to speak.

Rex: Thanks. I will. And now, I better call Roxy -- tell her you found her stolen money.
Bo: Ok.
Rex: Thanks for listening.
Bo: Hmm.

Antonio: Nora, we're doing the best we can.

Nora: It's not good enough. Antonio, my son is traumatized. My house burns down to the ground and the insurance company thinks that I'm the arsonist. And all we've got right now -- our only piece of evidence is some blurry photograph here that means a damn nothing! Nothing!
Bo: What's going on out here?

Adriana: How many days till it gets shipped? All right.

Woman: The hotel. We're here on a conference.

Tate: All-American boy.
Adriana: Look, I was talking to my manufacturer, and he said that we're a go for the New England winter line, so --
Tate: Can I just say one thing, though?
Adriana: Sure.

Tate: That kiss wasn't the worst thing that's happened to me in the last few hours. What I'm saying is, Adriana, if you didn't have a boyfriend, I would be interested in kissing you a whole lot more. You know that, don't you?

Rex: Thank you.

Evangeline: "Fairly educated." Well, let me tell you something, Marty, I'm not seeing Todd. I'm spending a lot of time with him, which I might feel guilty about if Cristian hadn't -- you know what? His actions make it clear to me that there is no hope for us.
Marty: And how does that make you feel?
Evangeline: How I feel is uncomfortable talking about this with you.
Marty: Well, it's obvious you need to talk to somebody about it.

Todd: Check now or check later. If it's Cole, I'm going to find out.

Cole: Starr, thank God. When I called before, I was afraid you got caught or something.

Starr: Yeah, well, you were lucky.

Evangeline: Why is it impossible to avoid the subject of Todd?

Marty: Because -- because every road invariably leads right back to him. You know -- ugh -- I had to make this gut-wrenching decision today about my son, a decision I wish I didn't have to make, and the reason I had to make it was -- oh -- because of Todd.

Evangeline: You know, I was at the ski lodge the other day when you had to confront Todd and Blair about whatever your kids were doing and -- I thought you handled that very well. I -- I can't imagine that it's easy for you dealing with the Mannings.
Marty: Thank you. Uh-huh -- no, it isn't.
Evangeline: See, look? You just opened up to me a little bit there and we didn't -- what'd you say?
Marty: Snap and --
Evangeline: Snarl?
Marty: Snarl.
Evangeline: At each other.
Marty: Yeah.
Evangeline: Wow. Go figure.
Marty: Who knew?
Evangeline: Well, Marty, I guess I should go.
Marty: Ok. And for what it's worth, I -- I'm truly sorry about you and Cristian.
Evangeline: Me, too.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tate: How could you not know that I'm interested in you? Or rather, that I would be if you were free?
Adriana: Huh. Well, I just wonder if you would say that to any girl who had a boyfriend.
Tate: Well, not every girl is as beautiful and smart and funny as you are. You really have no idea how unbelievably gorgeous you are, do you?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Bo: Hey, Bud. How you feeling, huh?
Matthew: Ok, I guess.
Bo: Yeah? You look a little green around the gills.
Matthew: Yeah, I threw up, so mom wouldn't let me go to school.
Bo: Yeah, she told me. Enough room on that couch for the old man, too?
Matthew: Well, I don't want to get you sick.
Bo: No germ would come near me. Come on, scoot over.
Matthew: Oh.
Bo: Has Nigel been taking good care of you?
Matthew: He tried to change my sheets when I was still in bed, like I'm in a hospital or something.
Bo: That's terrible.
Matthew: I mean, I know he's just trying to be nice, but when I'm home sick, mom just leaves me alone.
Bo: Yeah. Does she ever give you the chicken soup treatment?
Matthew: Yeah.
Bo: You know, I'll bet you Nigel would probably make some soup for you.
Matthew: No!
Bo: Ok. No soup for you.
Matthew: He'd probably spend all day in the kitchen making me homemade soup.
Bo: Yeah. And you like the kind that you can nuke in the microwave, right?
Matthew: They don't even have one.
Bo: What, a microwave? All right. Actually, they do. The cook keeps it stashed way in the back of the pantry. Now, don't tell her that I'm the one that told you that, ok? I'm sworn to secrecy.
Matthew: Well, what's the point of having one if I can't use it? That's the problem with this whole place.
Bo: I know that things are kind of rough for you right now, but you know what? If you'd be more comfortable, you're welcome to come and stay at my place. I'd love to have you.
Matthew: Thanks, but mom would be lonely. Besides, she's been a little crazy -- or stressed.
Bo: Ah. And you're worried about her?
Matthew: I guess.
Bo: Yeah. I'll be honest with you -- so am I. But I'm going to keep an eye on her, all right? I'm not going to let anything bad happen.
Matthew: Thanks, dad, but I know you can't promise that.
Bo: Well, I wish I could.
Matthew: Yeah, me, too.
Bo: All righty. Now, tell me -- what has Pa been doing lately? Ha -- bet it's so wacky.

Matthew: I swear I've never seen him like this before he went in the hospital. He's been making bad jokes all the time and he's been grabbing Renee and kissing her a lot more. And he's been saying that he feels like a million bucks.
Bo: Only one million?
Matthew: I know! And he's been saying that he went in the hospital for an oil change and now he's as good as new.
Bo: So you've been spending a lot of time with Renee and him, hmm?
Matthew: Mom and Uncle Clint, too.
Bo: Do you miss your friends?
Matthew: I see them at school.
Bo: Yeah, but you -- that's not the same. It's not like going to the movies or hanging out eating pizza. You get to the park much?
Matthew: It's still too cold out.
Bo: No, it isn't. Come on! That never stopped you before.
Matthew: I know, but I'm just sick and tired of everyone fussing over me. I just want to be left alone. Sorry.
Bo: No, that's ok. I get it.
Matthew: You do?

Bo: Yeah. But I still think it's a good idea if you have your buddies over here. Invite them over. You know what I think they should do? Big sleepover, right over here. You guys could all camp out in the tach room there in the stables, order out for pizza, have them delivered in -- no servants, no staff, no grandparents. I would be happy to stand guard for you.
Matthew: If mom says it's ok.
Bo: What do moms know about camping?
Matthew: Yeah, especially my mom.
Bo: Yeah, and besides, she's busy right now trying to find a house for you two to live in, so why don't you let the old man handle your social calendar for a while? Deal?
Matthew: Deal.
